post_text: November 21 is World Hello Day. Anyone can participate in World Hello Day simply by greeting ten people. This demonstrates the importance of personal communication for preserving peace. Join people from across the globe today in saying hello and be a part of the movement for peace and kindness. #BeKindGPISD #Greet10PeopleForPeace

post_text: Sometimes the best plans go awry. When students find themselves going down a different path than they imagined, it can be disappointing and scary. Xello lessons help students prepare for the unexpected by understanding the importance of backup careers and using their knowledge and skills to develop solid career backup plans. Sometimes the best things happen when you least expect them. Stay open to new possibilities. www.gpisd.org/xello

post_text: Dance. Piano lessons. Destination Imagination. Soccer practice. Scouts. Homework. Kids are busy and parents are stressed. Quality time doesn't have to happen at home. It can be spelling words in the car or doing homework in the stands of your little brother's baseball game. Car rides are great times to turn off the radio and talk to your kids about their day. Parent Involvement happens at school, at home, and on the road. #BeInvolvedGPISD

post_text: Finding the right college can be a struggle. GPISD counselors help our students find the right match for them. Using the lessons and other tools in Xello, students identify school factors that are important to them, such as school size and admission requirements, and compare technical, 2-year, and 4-year college to find their best match. For more information, visit www.gpisd.org/xello.

post_text: Traditional sports teams don’t appeal to every student, but students can still learn lessons about teamwork and commitment in other ways. SGP Early College High School has a new E-Gaming team for e-athletes. The team began this semester and play competitively against other Texas schools in the Rocket League. Two of the three teams are undefeated. Nine students play in the Rocket League while another 12-15 students play in local tournaments. The sponsor, Jeremy Dunn states that they are also looking into being a chapter of NASEF (North America Scholastic Esports Federation), which has opportunities for internships, scholarships, and networking across the country. Thanks to the SGP ECHS Administration and GPISD Technology Department for their support.

post_text: GPISD is providing college AND career readiness. These students are prepared for the workforce with their cosmetology license completed before they graduate from high school. With their license in hand, they can go directly to work or work their way through college. Congratulations to these students and their hard-working advisors.
shared_text:
Dubiski Career High School
November 14, 2019 at 8:44 PM ·

Congratulations to our A-Day Cosmotolgoy Seniors as they are now fully licensed Cosmetologists! This group of 22 Seniors have passed the written exam, the practical exam, and have completed their 1000 experience hours all before 2020!!! We are SO PROUD of these young ladies and can't wait to see all the great things they will do!

post_text:
GPISD is outperforming the nation in College Readiness! The national AVID office has released statistics for the Class of 2019, and GPISD seniors shine.

*Nationally 61% of high school seniors completed the FAFSA.
* GPISD had 98% of the Class of 2019 complete the FAFSA.
*Applying for financial aid is one of the best predictors of whether a graduate will go on to college.

GPISD seniors are outperforming their peers across Texas and the nation thanks to the hard work of their teachers, counselors, and college and career advisors.

post_text: Earlier this morning, as a result of a science experiment, there was a gas smell in several of the hallways at South Grand Prairie High School. The Grand Prairie Fire Department responded and determined the air quality was safe for students and staff. Atmos Energy is also on site to conduct an air quality test. As a precaution, students in two hallways were moved to the cafeteria, and all other students were being held in classes. At this time, we are told there is no danger to students or staff.

post_text: Congratulations to Diego Salazar and his teachers at Grand Prairie Fine Arts Academy.
shared_text:
Grand Prairie Fine Arts Academy
November 13, 2019 at 9:49 PM ·

Junior Diego Salazar was selected to the Texas All-State Jazz Ensemble.

Diego placed 3rd on drum set out of the hundreds of students auditioning from across the state and will perform with the band at the annual Texas Music Educators Association Convention in San Antonio this coming February.

Making a music group at TMEA All-State places that student in the top 2% of all HS musicians in Texas. Students are selected through a rigorous audition process which began last September and concluded just this week.

Congratulations to Diego Salazar, Texas All-State Jazz musician, for this incredible honor and recognition!

Congratulations to Diego Salazar and his teachers at Grand Prairie Fine Arts Academy.

Congratulations to Diego Salazar, Texas All-State Jazz musician, for this incredible honor and recognition!
